p: Excessive exploitation and exposure to anthropogenic activities can cause a change in the chemical composition of A. vulgaris. In addition, the species rarely reproduces from seeds, which require symbiosis with soil microflora for germination. An alternative way of reproduction for the plant is micropropagationâ€”a technique used for rapid multiplication in vitro. It provides conditions under which the progeny plant is genetically stable and its metabolites are identical in chemical composition to that of the parent plant [ 69].
